title: How to meet Ellen DeGeneres - Quora

response.answer_text: Check out her official site, but you’ve gotta be 14 or older → Request Tickets - Available Dates. However. getting tickets doesn’t guarantee you’ll actually meet her; you’ll just be in the same room as her. But now I’m going to tell you the true story of how my friend met Ellen. It was my friend’s first time visiting Los Angeles, so she wore an extremely nice outfit (all Burberry) and was with her equally well-dressed cousin. I guess they stood out from the rest of the tourists and a production person came up to them and said, “Are you here to see Ellen?” Well, yes they were, so of course they replied yes. She led them inside the studio, away from the rest of the other studio audience members. At this point, they figured something was up, but just went with it. She dropped them off in the green room, where there were snacks and beverages. My friend, who’s a nurse, didn’t even know what green room meant and thought they were picked to be in a game. Maybe 15–20 minutes later, the staff member came back with…Ellen DeGeneres. TLDR → Get tickets to be in her studio audience, dress super nice, get mistaken for a VIP guest and be personally introduced to Ellen in the green room.

There are several ways. 1. Go see her show. 2. Find out where she parks her car when she does the show and go to that spot and wait. 3. Write her a letter saying you are very sick and one of your dreams is to meet her. 4. Find out where she lives and go knock on her door and say you are lost and need to use the telephone. But you have to be convincing. 5. Find out where she eats, has a drink, gets her hair cut or her nails done, and go there and wait for her. 6. Contact her agent or manager and say you are with a well known magazine and want to interview her for the cover. Tell them it’s a gay oriented one. Go to a secret database I can’t tell you about, and you’ll find her address and phone number in it. Then call her and get her to answer and make up some story. “Hi Ellen, it’s me, Nancy Cohen, I’m calling to say hello. How are you!? Let her talk. She should sort of think she knows you, but you have to make her believe it. They meet a ton of people and she’ll hear the name and her mind will say, “OH”… then she’ll play along with you and will think she knows you. When you think she is sufficiently knowing you, ask if you can come for a visit, is she still at her Bel Air house or the one in Santa Barbara. Good luck
